definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
messenger of death (cf Irish banshee)/person bringing bad luck

sentences.english: Reportedly, the two door god affixed to the door, and all Jiaomoguiguai will be daunting.
sentences.chinese: 據說，大門上貼上兩位門神，一切魔怪都會望而生畏。

sentences.english: Our country New Year has posted shot-stopper customs.
sentences.chinese: 我國各地過年都有貼門神的風俗。

sentences.english: Ndiaye also put into a tube to wasp to sting god was kneeling down to beg for mercy.
sentences.chinese: 阿耶又放了一筒地馬蜂進去，把門神蜇得跪地求饒。

sentences.english: Two fierce warriors guard the entrance to many Chinese temples.
sentences.chinese: 中國許多寺廟的入口處，都立着兩尊凶神惡煞的門神。

sentences.english: During Pre-Qing-Dynasty period, door-god worship reached a climax.
sentences.chinese: 先秦時期，門神崇拜達到高峯。

sentences.english: Door gods are pictures of deities posted on the door, where they can protect the household from evil.
sentences.chinese: 門神是貼在門上的神像，據說門神能保全家平安。

sentences.english: Door gods are pictures of deities posted on the door, where they can protect the household from evil.
sentences.chinese: 門神是貼在門上的神像，據說門神能保全家平安。

sentences.english: Spending the Spring Festival , country folks liked pasting down door-gods.
sentences.chinese: 過年時，鄉下人喜歡貼門神。

sentences.english: The evolvement of folk door spirit had direct connection to the imperial advocation.
sentences.chinese: 民間門神的演變與皇家對民風的倡導有着直接的關係。

sentences.english: Many times Door God or the Character "Fu"is added to doors along with the couplets.
sentences.chinese: 門神和福字一般都是和對聯配套的貼在門上的。

sentences.english: Wamao placed on the lintel is regarded as Door-God.
sentences.chinese: 置於大門門頭的瓦貓，有門神的作用。

definition: ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil
(myth.) peaches of immortality, kept by Xi Wangmu/fresh or confectionery peaches offered as a birthday gift
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
to arrive home/facing one's home/home-coming/(soccer) facing the goalmouth
Spring Festival couplet (the first line of which is pasted on the right side of a doorway at New Year, and the second on the left side)
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
